summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from October 2019 coordinating logistics for FBI Victim Services Division briefings for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, scheduled for October 15 in Miami and October 23 in New York. The emails discuss the involvement of public affairs personnel and emphasize that victim specialists, not other FBI staff, should handle media advice for victims.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential contact for the Miami briefing; appears to be part of FBI Public Affairs.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in Miami
events.description: Scheduled FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to be held at the Miami Field Office.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in New York
events.description: Scheduled FBI Victim Services Division briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein to be held in New York.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division organized briefings for victims of Jeffrey Epstein in Miami (October 15) and New York (October 23) in 2019.
Internal FBI discussions emphasized that victim specialists, not public affairs or other untrained staff, should provide media advice to victims, referencing specific training and guidelines.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI HQ, field offices (Miami and New York), and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding victim outreach.
The document references an active investigation (Case Number: NY-3027571) and indicates victim services were being offered without disclosing specific investigative details.
